alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Hocking; Pickaway; Pike; Ross; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 1:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FAIRFIELD, HOCKING, SOUTHEASTERN PICKAWAY, EASTERN PIKE, NORTHEASTERN SCIOTO AND EASTERN ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 200 PM EDT... At 130 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Pleasantville to 6 miles northeast of Clarktown, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Pickerington, Logan, Waverly, Canal Winchester, Nelsonville, Baltimore, Piketon, Bremen, Millersport, Pleasantville, Hide-A-Way Hills, Hocking Hills State Park, Starr, Royalton, Lithopolis, Amanda, Londonderry, New Straitsville and Thurston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Fairfield; Hocking; Pickaway; Pike; Ross; Scioto
